basics.name: Patrick Webster
basics.label: Software Developer, Programmer
basics.summary: Senior Software Engineer with 5+ years experience building software applications. I am a full stack developer with a passion for frontend web-based technologies. Patrick is adept and enthusiastic about learning new technologies and bringing his previous experience to a motivated team.

work.summary: Worked at Akiri, a healthcare networking start-up, building a cloud-based product aimed at resolving the problems around the exchanging healthcare data.
highlights: Built a web-based user interface for cloud-based network to facilitate the exchange of healthcare information.
Built a authentication solution around Auth0. This includes email notification around password management.
Responsible for Unit and E2E testing of user interface using Jest and Cypress.
Responsible for security and performance optimization of the web-based user interface.
Leveraged technologies such as Docker, Kotlin, Vertx, Vue, and Vuetify.

work.summary: Worked with a team building a product codenamed Nautilus, a real-time analytics platform that combines the power of Apache Flink and Pravega, a new open source project for streaming storage.
highlights: Built a web-based user interface for the management and monitoring of Pravega and Flink
Built a monitoring solution based on the influx TICK stack on top of DCOS.
Built live charts to view the real-time streaming data.
Responsible for Unit and E2E testing of user interface using Protractor and Jasmine.
Leveraged technologies such as Mesos, DCOS, Docker, InfluxDB, and Angular.

work.summary: Worked on a UI team building Neutrino, an appliance that provided a turn-key OpenStack cluster.
highlights: Built a web-based user interface for installation, upgrade, monitoring and management of container services.
Built a task monitoring solution that enabled visibility into service deployement.
Migrated the UI from AngularJS to Angular 2 in a phased approach.
Implemented a web-based version of ScaleIO's UI using AngularJS.
Build a solution around Websockets for keeping UI instance in sync.
Leveraged technologies such as Docker, Java, Angular, Websockets, and RxJS.
